did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: New York State College of Agriculture winter short course photographs, 1907-1926.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Composite photographs and prints of the students and faculty members who attended the winter short courses at Cornell. Composites include the general agriculture, poultry, dairy, and horticulture classes.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The first winter short course (Dairy) was given in 1892-93. These courses were provided during the winter to teach practical education to non-traditional students. The courses were inline with Cornell's Land Grant mission. The majority of the students were New York State farmers.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Composite photographs and prints of the students and faculty members who attended the winter short courses at Cornell. Composites include the general agriculture, poultry, dairy, and horticulture classes.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture.
New York State College of Agriculture -- Students.
New York State College of Agriculture -- Faculty.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS
descgrp.p: Items very FRAGILE, handle with care.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: New York State College of Agriculture winter short course photographs, #21-34-2459. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also New York State College of Agriculture Winter Short Course Scrapbooks, #21-34-4029.
See also the Michael L. and Catherine H. Whalen Collection of Cornelliana, #37-5-3784.
See also Dairy Industry Winter Course Student Record Cards, #21-19-1190.
